p: When the cost C is low, the models show some interesting qualitative differences. In phase 1, individuals' tendency toward counter-compliance is constant at q = 1.0, meaning that individuals have no incentive to self-isolate; in this case, the FES is highest. However, in phase 2 in which q depends on both cost and time, FES is lower in the phase 2 model for small C and the models behave the same for higher C.
